fr1.title: Right to Equality
fr1.description: Includes Equality before law (Art 14), Prohibition of discrimination (Art 15), Equality of opportunity (Art 16), Abolition of untouchability (Art 17), and Abolition of titles (Art 18).

fr2.title: Right to Freedom
fr2.description: Includes six freedoms: Speech and expression, Assembly, Association, Movement, Residence, and Profession (Art 19). Also covers protection in conviction (Art 20), Life & Liberty (Art 21), Right to Education (Art 21A), and protection against arrest (Art 22).

fr3.title: Right against Exploitation
fr3.description: Prohibition of human trafficking and forced labor (Art 23), and prohibition of child labor in hazardous jobs (Art 24).

fr4.title: Right to Freedom of Religion
fr4.description: Freedom of conscience and free profession, practice, and propagation of religion (Art 25), freedom to manage religious affairs (Art 26), freedom from taxes for religion (Art 27), and freedom from religious instruction (Art 28).

fr5.title: Cultural and Educational Rights
fr5.description: Protection of interests of minorities (Art 29) and right of minorities to establish and administer educational institutions (Art 30).

fr6.title: Right to Constitutional Remedies
fr6.description: Right to move the Supreme Court for enforcement of Fundamental Rights (Art 32).

w1.title: Right to Zero FIR
w1.description: A woman can file an FIR at any police station irrespective of the location of the incident.

w2.title: Right to Privacy while Recording Statement
w2.description: A woman can record her statement with a female constable and in private.

w3.title: No Arrest at Night
w3.description: Women cannot be arrested after sunset and before sunrise, except in exceptional circumstances with a magistrate's order.

w4.title: Right to Equal Pay
w4.description: Women are entitled to equal pay for equal work as men.

w5.title: Maternity Benefits
w5.description: Right to paid maternity leave for 26 weeks for the first two children.

w6.title: Protection from Domestic Violence
w6.description: Right to protection against physical, mental, verbal, or economic abuse at home.

c1.title: Right to Free and Compulsory Education
c1.description: Every child between the ages of 6 and 14 has the right to free and compulsory education.

c2.title: Protection from Child Labor
c2.description: Prohibition of employment of children below 14 years in factories, mines, or hazardous employment.

c3.title: Protection from Sexual Offenses (POCSO)
c3.description: Strict laws to protect children from sexual assault, harassment, and pornography.

s1.title: Right to Information
s1.description: Students can request copies of their answer sheets and other institutional information.

s2.title: Anti-Ragging Rights
s2.description: Ragging is a criminal offense. Students have the right to a ragging-free campus.

e1.title: Right to Minimum Wages
e1.description: Every employee has the right to be paid at least the minimum wage fixed by the government.

e2.title: Prevention of Sexual Harassment (POSH)
e2.description: Right to a safe workplace free from sexual harassment.

e3.title: Right to Gratuity
e3.description: Employees working for 5+ years are entitled to gratuity upon termination/retirement.

co1.title: Right to Safety
co1.description: Protection against goods and services that are hazardous to life and property.

co2.title: Right to Choose
co2.description: Right to be assured access to a variety of goods and services at competitive prices.

co3.title: Right to Seek Redressal
co3.description: Right to seek compensation against unfair trade practices or exploitation.

a1.title: Right to Know Grounds of Arrest
a1.description: Police must inform the arrested person of the grounds of arrest immediately.

a2.title: Right to be Produced before Magistrate
a2.description: An arrested person must be produced before a magistrate within 24 hours.

a3.title: Right to Legal Aid
a3.description: Right to consult a lawyer of choice and free legal aid if indigent.

sc1.title: Right to Maintenance
sc1.description: Senior citizens can claim maintenance from children/heirs if unable to maintain themselves.

sc2.title: Tax Benefits
sc2.description: Higher exemption limits and tax benefits for senior citizens.

m1.title: Protection against False Dowry Cases
m1.description: Legal remedies available against misuse of Section 498A (Dowry Harassment).

m2.title: Right to Child Custody
m2.description: Fathers have equal rights to seek custody of their children.

t1.title: Right against Unfair Eviction
t1.description: Landlords cannot evict tenants without proper notice and valid legal grounds.

t2.title: Right to Essential Services
t2.description: Landlord cannot cut off water or electricity supply to force eviction.
